features: New Version: Especially designed for Swiffer PowerMop, these reusable mop pads are 100% compatible with swiffer power mop. Made of high quality microfiber, have strong absorption, clean thoroughly without harming your hard wood floors. These swiffer power mop refills are also compatible with other 13-15 Inches microfiber floor mop.

Save Your Money and Reduce Waste: These reusable mop pads for swiffer power mop are machine washable and can be wash up to 100+ times. One reusable refill pad is equal to 100+ disposable mop cloths, you needn't rely on expensive disposable mop cloths any more. Just choose UMAYCOOL mop pads refills, save a lot of money for you every year and reduce waste for the earth.

Wet and Dry Use: These reusable swiffer power pads can be dry and wet use. The swiffer power mop reusable pads can easily pick up dirt, dust and pet hair when used for dry mopping; and the swiffer power mop refills pads can effectively absorb water, oil and other wet messes when used for wet mopping. Help you clean more effectively and save your cleaning time.

Safe on All Floor Types: Our reusable mop pads for swiffer powermop are safe on all floor types, include hardwood, tile, laminate, bamboo, stone, marble, vinyl and etc. They leave no scratches, making them perfect for cleaning dirt, pet hair, dust, huamn hair, debris, grime and kitchen grease, keeping your home clean and tidy at all time.

Great Gift for Your Family and Pets: The package includes 9 PACK swiffer power mop replacement pads. These power mop refills are 100% compatible with swiffer powermop and other 13''-15'' microfiber spray mop. If your pets shed a lot, these thicken swiffer mop pads refill can pick up pet hair easily, keep your home tidy all the time, your kids can play freely at home. If you have any questions in using, please feel free to contact us.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Saver of money. Awesome
reviews.reviewText: I was intrigued if was going to stick properly and for my surprise its amazing. Fits super well and dont leave your floor wet and also dont fall off. This is a saver of money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars New Design Works Better on Tile Flooring
reviews.reviewText: I have used the older design on my Swiffer Power Mop. The fibers on the older design were very tightly woven, and really dense and thick. It was harder for me to mop my tile floors because I experienced a drag that made the mop harder to maneuver. The new and improved design is thinner than the old design. The yarn on the new version is not as tightly woven as the older version. The new version's yarn is looped and protrudes outward a bit. It looks kind of like a shag rug. The older version looks like a tightly knitted fabric.Functionally, the new version glides across my tile floor easier than the older version. I think this is because it is thinner and because the fibers are looser and not as dense as the older version. I had no difficulty mopping my tile floor without having to do anything special. The older version had a bit of a drag only on my kitchen tile flooring. To counter this, I had to soak the mopping pad in water to completely saturate it, and I had to poor cups of water on my tiles in order to be able to get the mopping pad to glide easily across the floor. I did not have to do that with the newer version of the mopping pad. I included pictures of the new version, the purple color, and the older version, the blue color, so that you could see the difference in their construction.The older version seems more durable than the new version because it is thicker, more dense, and the yarn is more tightly woven. But in terms of ease of use, the new version wins. It is easier to maneuver on tile floors. It works more like the manufacturer's mopping pads in that respect. Both version were better at removing more dirt comparatively to the manufacturer's disposal mopping pads. There was no difference in how both versions worked on my hardwood floors.This design is better than older version because it is easier to use on tiles. Because of the issues that I had on my tiles, I am glad they re-designed these to work more like the manufacturer's replacement pads. I generally liked these replacement pads over the Swiffer Power Mop replacement pads because I can save a few dollars by using these instead of having to constantly buy their replacement mopping pads. I also feel like I am doing my part to help the environment by helping to reduce waste.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A Little Thin
reviews.reviewText: The six 14 1/2" by 4 3/4" mop pads have a smooth backing the holds on tightly to the velcro surface of my mop head so they don't slip or wrinkle when I mop the tile floors. They machine wash well -- I let them drip dry afterwards and they are dry by the next morning and ready to use again.The front fabric is rough enough to scrub off the dirt but soft enough to avoid damaging the floor. I found them to work very well as a dust mop when I used them dry on the wooden floors.The reason I only rate them with 4 stars is because they are rather thin and have no padding between the front and the back fabrics. The lack of padding makes them less absorbent when I need to sop up spilled liquids. The lack of padding doesn't affect the way then clean though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These reusable Swiffer mop pads work well. They stick to the Velcro of the mop head and they clean better than the disposable ones.I also use these on a dry Swiffer duster mop, just poke the corners into the holding area on the top of the mop and you are all set. I like to be able to dry sweep for pet hair before I vacuum and/or wash the floors. Once done I take them outside and shake them out. When they get dirty I wash them.Note: if you have red clay dirt like I do, you will want to wash the mop pads as soon as possible or else the red clay will stain them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Absorbent microfiber mop pads for Swiffer PowerMop
reviews.reviewText: These microfiber mop pads refills are very nicely made. The seams are nicely done and the backing of these pads stick well to the velcro backing of the Swiffer Powermop. These pads stay put and do not bunch or move while mopping the floors.These can be used for dry and wet mopping and does a great job of picking up the dirt and messes. These mop pads work great on different types of floors. These are very absorbent and the floors are quickly dried without leaving any streaks or marks.The price is great for this 6 pack of reusable mop pads. They are easy to clean and dry and saves a ton of money in the long run. I will continue to buy these economical and environmentally mop heads over the original Swiffer mop refills.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect fit, easy to wash.
reviews.reviewText: The 2nd photo is a dirty mop and the 3rd is after I washed the reusable pad in the washer. I recommend rinsing/washing immediately after using that way the grease and dirt doesn’t dry into the fabric pads. The pads go on easily and stick tightly to the power mop. I have 3 dogs who are constantly bringing dirt and sticks into the house and this allows for a quick footprint/ accident clean up using my power mop. They do get dirty quickly but enjoy not having to buy disposable pads and easy to run in a small load of wash with dog towels.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly plush and absorbent for microfiber
reviews.reviewText: I have a variety of microfiber pads for my spray mop. In general, I like them but they tend to work more as a wet broom than an actual mop. The dampness picks up more than a dry broom alone.These pads would be the exception. They seem fluffier and more absorbent than my other mop pads, meaning I can actually use them as proper mop heads for cleaning the floor, as well as wiping up liquid messes (as opposed to what usually happens, which is that the liquid just gets pushed around). Since they are absorbent, they also dry my floor more quickly and don't leave as many streaky marks.They stuck easily to my generic mop base. The only thing I needed to do was pull up the washing care tag so that the entire pad could stick to the mop. There is a small elastic loop as well - not sure if it's for a certain brand of mop or if it is just a loop so that you can hang up the pads, but it's handy.Overall, a very impressive and reasonably priced product.
